description: From Ancient Greek συνέχεια (sunékheia, “continuity”), from σύν (sún, “with, together”) + ἔχειν (ékhein, “hold”).

nouns.description: synechia (countable and uncountable, plural synechias or synechiae)

entries.meaning: (pathology) An eye condition in which the iris adheres either to the cornea (anterior synechia) or to the lens (posterior synechia).
